BNC User Reference Guide

<align>

align marks an temporal alignment point within transcribed speech.
Class model.ptrLike
Declaration 
element align { attribute with { data.pointer }, empty }
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes)
with supplies an arbitrary identifier; all elements specifying the same value for this attribute are understood to be aligned with each other in time.
Status: Required
Datatype (1–1) data.pointer
Values: A unique identifier in the form....
Example
 <u who="PS6SF"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <s n="12">
   <w c5="VVB" hw="tell" pos="VERB">tell </w>
   <w c5="NP0" hw="billy" pos="SUBST">Billy </w>
   <align with="KSWLC001"/>
   <w c5="DT0" hw="that" pos="ADJ">that </w>
  </s>
 </u>
 <u who="PS6SJ">
  <s n="13">
   <align with="KSWLC001"/>
   <w c5="ITJ" hw="hello" pos="INTERJ">Hello </w>
   <w c5="AV0" hw="now" pos="ADV">now </w>
   <w c5="VM0" hw="can" pos="VERB">can </w>
   <w c5="PNP" hw="you" pos="PRON">you </w>
   <w c5="VVI" hw="hear" pos="VERB">hear </w>
   <w c5="PNP" hw="i" pos="PRON">me</w>
  </s>
 </u>
Module module-from-bncxml
